durability_reason: The evidence does not mention long‑term contracts, permanent institutions, ongoing maintenance plans, or sustainable revenue mechanisms that would ensure the continuation of poverty‑reduction activities beyond the project period. The sentences highlight dependency on the project for economic benefits and lack of reported sustainability measures, indicating no convincing long‑term durability.
level_support_sentences: Increases in the number of people or families who have an economic benefit; without the project, these people or families are unlikely to experience an increase in their income or economic benefits, which could affect their quality of life and ability to meet their basic needs.

With the development of sustainable production projects promoted by the REDD+ Project RIU‑SM, the viability of sustainable economic activities reduces pressure on the forests, providing economic opportunities for local residents and native families (validated PDD‑VCS, p. 318).

The improvement in agricultural practices and the development of productive projects strengthen food availability to meet the needs of indigenous communities and allow surpluses to be marketed or used to address contingencies arising from crop and product losses due to climate change (Project Activities A2.1 and A2.3).
It also identifies productive projects to generate additional income for the communities.

Implementation of Project Activity A2.3 identifies alternative forms of production that generate better economic income conditions for families in each community group and improves marketing mechanisms through the establishment and strengthening of productive chain projects.
evidence_quality_support_sentences: Number of women participating in the productive projects to ensure food security, self‑sustainability, and improved economic income: 5 women are part of the families responsible for developing the pilot agroforestry project of cocoa, banana, corn, and abarco (according to Annex 4.6.1.1j of the verified Monitoring Report – VCS 2018 & 2019).
durability_support_sentences: The beneficiary families do not see improvements in their economic conditions since the implementation of the productive projects.

Increases in the number of people or families who have an economic benefit; without the project, these people or families are unlikely to experience an increase in their income or economic benefits, which could affect their quality of life and ability to meet their basic needs.
sdg_claim_support_sentences: In line with SDG 1 (No Poverty), developing pilot production projects such as agroforestry, agro‑silvopastoral community tourism, and ornamental fish production creates opportunities for participating families, thereby contributing to poverty reduction and supporting SDG 7.
